citeinfo.title: Table of Field Observations With Quantitative Displacement Measurements Obtained From Surface Faulting and Ground Deformation Features Produced by the Ridgecrest M6.4 and M7.1 Earthquake Sequence of July 4 and 5, 2019: Provisional Release 1
Documentation of surface fault rupture and ground-deformation features produced by the 4 and 5 July 2019 Mw 6.4 and Mw 7.1 Ridgecrest earthquake sequence

descript.abstract: This dataset contains a provisional release of field observations at sites of fault rupture and ground deformation features where quantitative displacement measurements were obtained. This release does not include associated photographs and some observations where there are outstanding questions about the measurements received; some duplicate observations may exist in this dataset. Photos and resolved measurement data are anticipated for a future release. This dataset consists of a comma-delimited ASCII text file where each line in the file represents an observation, suitable for importing into a spreadsheet, database or GIS application for visualization and analysis. These data are also summarized in a companion Google Earth Keyhole Markup Language (kmz) file for easy visualization, which shows each observation as a placemark with observation data displayed in the description balloon.
descript.purpose: The purpose of this compilation is to present the data as reported, interpreted only as necessary to assemble the information into the compilation schema and with as much metadata about the observation as possible. We apply no measure of field quality; future researchers can evaluate the reported data for their purposes by assessing measurement completeness, reported uncertainties and measurement approaches, variability of multiple measurements at the same site or nearby, and/or evaluation of photographic evidence.

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted.

dataqual.logic: No formal logical accuracy tests were conducted.
dataqual.complete: Data set is considered complete for the information presented, as described in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details.

horizpa.horizpar: No formal positional accuracy tests were conducted. See larger work for discussion on location accuracy.

vertacc.vertaccr: No formal positional accuracy tests were conducted.

procstep.procdesc: Field observations were submitted directly from field participants and consist of notes, descriptions, and measurements that document the existence and character of faulting or ground deformation at a geographic point. Observations of damage to buildings or earthen structures such as embankments or fills are not included in the compilation unless they reflect permanent deformation of the natural ground surface. All contributed site data were extracted from their originally provided formats, parsed, and loaded into a spatial database using a compilation schema developed by USGS and CGS. Each data record represents an observation of faulting, ground deformation or no deformation, that was made by an investigator or field team working together during a unique visit on a specific date. If the same observer/team revisits the same locality on a different day or time and records a separate observation, this constitutes a separate data record. Similarly, observations made by different field teams at the same locality are preserved as separate observation records. The goal of the compilation is to present the data as reported, interpreted only as necessary to assemble the information into the compilation schema and with as much metadata about the observation as possible.

enttyp.enttypd: Table containing attribute information associated with the data set.

attr.attrdef: Observation identifier assigned at compilation

attrdomv.udom: Internal identifier. Serves as a primary key for the data record as this value is unique within the dataset.

attr.attrdef: Original name or ID of observation station as defined by the observer

attrdomv.udom: The original name or ID of the observation station as defined by the observer. As different observers use their own system for labeling their observations, there is no guarantee that these values are unique within this dataset.

attr.attrdef: The principal team member making the observation.

attrdomv.udom: The first initial and the last name of the individual that collected the data, or the primary contact for the data.

attr.attrdef: The agency or organization affiliated with the principal observer.

edom.edomvd: California Seismic Safety Commission
California Department of Conservation, California Geological Survey
TCalifornia State University, Fullerton
Desert Research Institute
High Desert Consulting
InfraTerra
Jet Propulsion Laboratory, California Institute of Technology
Pacific Gas and Electric
Southern California Earthquake Center
University of California, Riverside
Scripps Institution of Oceanography, University of California, San Diego
University of Hawaii, Manoa
University of Nevada, Reno
University of Southern California
United States Geological Survey
United States Navy

attr.attrdef: Field team identifier

attrdomv.udom: A textual description that is the identifier for a team of observers working together. The identifer is in the form of mm/dd-##, surrounded by single quotes to parse as text in Excel.

attr.attrdef: Team members

attrdomv.udom: List of participants (first initial, last name, and affiliation) working together who contributed to the observation. Note: kmz version shows the team identifier as a link that displays team members.

attr.attrdef: The location of the observer relative to the actual deformation.

edom.edomvd: The primary observer was at the location of the recorded observation.
The primary observer collected the observation location from an aircraft.
The primary observer collected the observation from remote sensed data such as aircraft or satellite imagery, InSAR, etc.
The observations was obtained from some other position.

attr.attrdef: The date and time that the observation was made. A textual description of the date as numeric values of the year, month, day separated by dashes. Time of observation is presented after the letter "T" with hours, minutes, seconds each separated by a colon and followed by a time zone offset. For example, 2019-07-05T17:44:55-07 represents July 5, 2019, at 5:44 PM and 55 seconds, with a time zone offset of -7 hours before Greenwich Mean Time.

rdom.attrunit: Year, Month, Day, Hours, Minutes, Seconds

attr.attrdef: An enumerated value describing the inferred origin of the observed feature, based on ground observations and other factors such as rupture continuity and surface expression.

edom.edomvd: An observation where the zone of deformation has strike and displacements consistent with the earthquake source mechanism. Sense of offset may be observed directly or inferred from patterns of en echelon surface fractures. Tectonic surface rupture includes both seismogenic rupture that has propagated to the surface from the earthquake source, and slip resulting from shallow strain release triggered by shaking or changes in near-surface stresses from the earthquakes.
A feature inferred to have been produced solely by shaking where the specific mechanism for the deformation is not determined.
A feature inferred to be produced by liquefaction-induced ground failure, including lateral spreads and sand boils.

A feature inferred to be produced by shaking-induced slope failure, including head scarps, lateral scarps and compressional toes of landslides, small-scale slumps, settlements, rock falls, and bank failures.

Observed deformation in which the feature strike and displacement could be attributable to either faulting or lateral spreading. This value is also used for observations in which the orientation and displacements measured in the field appear not to be consistent with the earthquake source mechanisms nor can the feature be readily attributable to typical earthquake-induced ground-failure mechanisms, such as liquefaction or shallow slope failure.

attr.attrdef: The earthquake presumed to have produced the observed deformation (M6.4 - July 4), (M7.1 - July 5), or Uncertain

edom.edomvd: Rupture likely produced by the M7.1 earthquake of July 5, 2019.
Rupture likely produced by the M6.4 earthquake of July 4, 2019.
Rupture that is not readily attributable to either the M6.4 or M7.1 events.

attr.attrdef: The citation to a published source if the observation's data is published elsewhere.

attrdomv.udom: Author(s), date and DOI of the publication

attr.attrdef: Description at the site, including any observer notes, etc.

attrdomv.udom: A textual description made by observers at the observation location.

attr.attrdef: Minimum value for fault strike or azimuth in degrees of arc.

rdom.attrunit: Beginning at true north (0 or 360-degrees) and moving clockwise on a 360 degree circle, east has azimuth 90-degrees, south 180-degrees, and west 270-degrees.

attr.attrdef: Preferred value for the strike of the fault, expressed as an azimuth in bearing form (0-360 degrees arc, 0 degrees = true north, right-hand rule relative to fault dip direction if known). Bearing should be taken over a relatively long baseline - 10s of meters if possible - centered over the site.

rdom.attrunit: Beginning at true north (0 or 360-degrees) and moving clockwise on a 360 degree circle, east has azimuth 90-degrees, south 180-degrees, and west 270-degrees.

attr.attrdef: Maximum value for fault strike or azimuth in degrees of arc.

rdom.attrunit: Beginning at true north (0 or 360-degrees) and moving clockwise on a 360 degree circle, east has azimuth 90-degrees, south 180-degrees, and west 270-degrees.

attr.attrdef: Estimate of the minimum fault dip in degrees arc.

rdom.attrunit: Measured in degrees arc (0-90 degrees, 0 degrees = horizontal).

attr.attrdef: Preferred value for dip of the fault as observed, in degrees arc (0-90 degrees, 0 degrees = horizontal).

rdom.attrunit: Measured in degrees arc (0-90 degrees, 0 degrees = horizontal).

attr.attrdef: Estimate of the maximum fault dip in degrees arc.

rdom.attrunit: Measured in degrees arc (0-90 degrees, 0 degrees = horizontal).

attr.attrdef: Estimate of the minimum value of the local fracture azimuth measurement, in degrees arc.

rdom.attrunit: Beginning at true north (0 or 360-degrees) and moving clockwise on a 360 degree circle, east has azimuth 90-degrees, south 180-degrees, and west 270-degrees.
Beginning at true north (0 or 360-degrees) and moving clockwise on a 360 degree circle, east has azimuth 90-degrees, south 180-degrees, and west 270-degrees.

attr.attrdef: Estimate of the maximum value of the local fracture azimuth measurement, in degrees arc.

rdom.attrunit: Beginning at true north (0 or 360-degrees) and moving clockwise on a 360 degree circle, east has azimuth 90-degrees, south 180-degrees, and west 270-degrees.

attr.attrdef: Estimate of the minimum value of the rupture width.

attrdomv.udom: A textual description of the rupture width, as a numerical value in meters.

attr.attrdef: Preferred value for the width of the rupture zone in meters, measured normal to strike of the fault.

attrdomv.udom: A textual description of the rupture width, as a numerical value in meters.

attr.attrdef: Estimate of the maximum value of the rupture width, in meters.

attrdomv.udom: A textual description of the rupture width, as a numerical value in meters.

attr.attrdef: A term describing the principal morphology of deformation at the site.

attrdomv.udom: A textual description of the nature of fault expression at the observation location.

attr.attrdef: Cardinal direction that the fault scarp faces (eg. the down-dropped side). Allowed values are: North, East, South, West.

edom.edomvd: Fault scarp faces North.
Fault scarp faces south.
Fault scarp faces east.
Fault scarp faces west.

attr.attrdef: Yes or No if fault plane is exposed and striations are observable.

edom.edomvd: Yes, the fault plane is exposed and striations are observable.
No, the fault plane is not exposed and/or striations are not observable.

attr.attrdef: Yes or No if fault plane is exposed and gouge is observable.

edom.edomvd: Yes, the fault plane is exposed and gouge is observable.
No, the fault plane is not exposed and/or gouge is not observable.

attr.attrdef: Dominant sense of slip on the fault.

edom.edomvd: Slip is dominantly left-lateral.
Slip where normal offset is between 0.5 and 1.5 times the value of left-lateral offset.
Slip where reverse offset is between 0.5 and 1.5 times the value of left-lateral offset.
Slip is dominantly right-lateral.
Slip where normal offset is between 0.5 and 1.5 times the value of right-lateral offset.
Slip where reverse offset is between 0.5 and 1.5 times the value of right-lateral offset.
Slip is dominantly of normal sense.
Slip is dominantly reverse sense and where fault dip is greater than 45 degrees.
Slip is dominantly reverse sense and where fault dip is less than 45 degrees.
Slip is dominantly extensional in sense, typically expressed as open fissures.

attr.attrdef: The faulted or deformed feature that is being observed or measured (eg. soil, channel margin, pavement, road edge, etc).

attrdomv.udom: A textual description of the faulted or deformed feature being observed.

attr.attrdef: Offset feature classification.

edom.edomvd: A naturally occurring feature such as a stream channel, dune, terrace edge, etc.
A man-made feature (eg. road, fence, curb).

attr.attrdef: Estimate of the minimum slip vector length.

attrdomv.udom: A textual description of the minimum slip vector length, represented as a real number in cm.

attr.attrdef: Preferred value for the length of the slip vector, in cm. This is the total slip on the fault plane that connects piercing points.

attrdomv.udom: A textual description of the preferred slip vector length, represented as a real number in cm.

attr.attrdef: Estimated maximum value for slip vector length.

attrdomv.udom: A textual description of the maximum slip vector length, represented as a real number in cm.

attr.attrdef: Estimate of the minimum vector plunge in degrees arc.

rdom.attrunit: Measured in degrees arc (0-90 degrees, 0 degrees = horizontal).

attr.attrdef: Preferred value for the plunge of the slip vector, in degrees arc (0 - 90 degrees; 0 degrees = horizontal).

rdom.attrunit: Measured in degrees arc (0-90 degrees, 0 degrees = horizontal).

attr.attrdef: Estimate of the maximum vector plunge in degrees arc.

rdom.attrunit: Measured in degrees arc (0-90 degrees, 0 degrees = horizontal).

attr.attrdef: Minimum slip vector azimuth, in degrees arc

rdom.attrunit: Beginning at true north (0 or 360-degrees) and moving clockwise on a 360 degree circle, east has azimuth 90-degrees, south 180-degrees, and west 270-degrees.

attr.attrdef: Preferred value for the slip vector azimuth (0-360 degrees in the down-plunge direction; 0 degrees = true north).

rdom.attrunit: Beginning at true north (0 or 360-degrees) and moving clockwise on a 360 degree circle, east has azimuth 90-degrees, south 180-degrees, and west 270-degrees.

attr.attrdef: Maximum slip vector azimuth.

rdom.attrunit: Beginning at true north (0 or 360-degrees) and moving clockwise on a 360 degree circle, east has azimuth 90-degrees, south 180-degrees, and west 270-degrees.

attr.attrdef: Estimate of the minimum value of the aperture in meters.

attrdomv.udom: A textual description of the minimum measurement aperture, as a real number, in meters.

attr.attrdef: The length, in meters, measured normal to the fault across which the measurement was taken.

attrdomv.udom: A textual description of the preferred measurement aperture, as a real number, in meters.

attr.attrdef: Estimate of the maximum measurement aperture distance, in meters.

attrdomv.udom: A textual description of the maximum measurement aperture, as a real number, in meters.

attr.attrdef: Estimate of the minimum horizontal offset or separation, in cm.

attrdomv.udom: A textual description of the minimum horizontal offset or separation, as a real number, in centimeters.

attr.attrdef: The preferred amount of horizontal offset or separation, in centimeters. This is the horizontal component of the slip vector or the horizontal separation of any displaced offset feature.

attrdomv.udom: A textual description of the preferred horizontal offset or separation, as a real number, in centimeters.

attr.attrdef: Estimate of the maximum value of the horizontal offset or separation, in centimeters.

attrdomv.udom: A textual description of the maximum horizontal offset or separation, as a real number, in centimeters.

attr.attrdef: Horizontal offset classification.

edom.edomvd: Measurement is of the horizontal separation of a displaced feature, usually measured normal to the feature azimuth but could be measured along any azimuth. Measurements with unrecorded horizontal separation azimuth's are assumed to be separations.
Measurement is of the displacement of a piercing point on the fault plane; eg. the horizontal component of the slip vector.

attr.attrdef: Estimate of the minimum value of the azimuth measurement, in degrees arc.
Preferred value of the azimuth of the horizontal offset component, or lateral separation of feature, as a bearing - in down plunge or down dip direction.
Estimate of the maximum value of the azimuth measurement, in degrees arc.
Estimate of the minimum value of the vertical offset, in cm.

attrdomv.udom: A textual description of the minimum vertical offset, as a numerical value in centimeters.

attr.attrdef: The preferred value for the amount of vertical displacement of the fault piercing point, in centimeters, or the measured value of the vertical separation of the land surface (vertical separation).

attrdomv.udom: A textual description of the vertical offset, as a numerical value in centimeters.

attr.attrdef: Estimate of the maximum value of the vertical offset, in cm.

attrdomv.udom: A textual description of the maximum vertical offset, as a numerical value in centimeters.

attr.attrdef: Classification of vertical slip.

edom.edomvd: Measurement is of the vertical separation of a displaced feature (typically the land surface). Measurements with unknown slip vector azimuths are inferred to be separations.
Measurement is of the vertical displacement of a piercing point on the fault plane; eg. the vertical component the slip vector.

attr.attrdef: Type of offset normal to fault plane.

edom.edomvd: The nature of offset normal to the fault plane is extensional.
The nature of offset normal to the fault plane is compressional.

attr.attrdef: Estimate of the minimum value of the extensional or compressional component across the fault.

attrdomv.udom: A textual value of the measurement in centimeters.

attr.attrdef: Preferred value for the component of slip normal to the fault that represents extension or compression.

attrdomv.udom: A textual description of the measurement in centimeters.

attr.attrdef: Estimate of the maximum value of the extensional or compressional component across the fault.

attrdomv.udom: A textual description of the measurement in centimeters.

attr.attrdef: Updated latitude.

attrdomv.udom: Latitude coordinate of the station in decimal degrees, WGS84 datum. These values are derived either from the coordinate provided directly by the observer, or are digitized during compilation using airborne imagery and ground photographs to more accurately locate the observation on the feature of interest. For provisional releases, this value is the same as the originally reported value except in cases where the coordinate value was clearly in error and a more accurate value could be recovered.

attr.attrdef: Updated longitude.

attrdomv.udom: Longitude coordinate of the station in decimal degrees, WGS84 datum. These values are derived either from the coordinate provided directly by the observer, or are digitized during compilation using airborne imagery and ground photographs to more accurately locate the observation on the feature of interest. For provisional releases, this value is the same as the originally reported value except in cases where the coordinate value was clearly in error and a more accurate value could be recovered.

attr.attrdef: Latitude as originally reported.

attrdomv.udom: Original latitude reported by the observer in decimal degrees, WGS84 datum.

attr.attrdef: Longitude as originally reported.

attrdomv.udom: Original longitude reported by the observer in decimal degrees, WGS84 datum.

attr.attrdef: Compiler notes.

attrdomv.udom: Any notes or disclaimers by the compilers about the observation.

cntaddr.address: Denver Federal Center, Building 810, Mail Stop 302

distinfo.distliab: Distributor assumes no liability for misuse of data.
distinfo.techpreq: Table is in CSV format, a tabular ascii text format delimited by commas.

metainfo.metstdn: Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
